body:
```
+ tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/jessie-backports.list
deb http://ftp.debian.org/debian jessie-backports main
+ apt-get update
Get:1 http://security.debian.org jessie/updates InRelease [94.4 kB]
Get:2 http://ftp.debian.org jessie-backports InRelease [166 kB]
Ign http://httpredir.debian.org jessie InRelease
Get:3 http://security.debian.org jessie/updates/main amd64 Packages [650 kB]
Get:4 http://httpredir.debian.org jessie-updates InRelease [145 kB]
Get:5 http://httpredir.debian.org jessie Release.gpg [2434 B]
Get:6 http://httpredir.debian.org jessie Release [148 kB]
Get:7 http://ftp.debian.org jessie-backports/main amd64 Packages [1170 kB]
Get:8 http://httpredir.debian.org jessie-updates/main amd64 Packages [23.0 kB]
Get:9 http://httpredir.debian.org jessie/main amd64 Packages [9064 kB]
Fetched 11.5 MB in 3s (3781 kB/s)
W: Failed to fetch http://ftp.debian.org/debian/dists/jessie-backports/main/binary-amd64/Packages  Hash Sum mismatch
```
It looks like the backport we're using is causing issues when running `apt-get update`. I'm going to leave this as a low priority, since only one PR has referenced this issue since 1/19.
